context.p: The XSLT/XQuery debugger does not step into Java classes that are configured as XSLT/XQuery extensions of the transformation. To step into Java classes, inspect variable values and set breakpoints in Java methods, set up a Java debug configuration in an IDE like the Eclipse SDK as described in the following steps:

substep.cmd: Set at least 256 MB as heap memory for the Java virtual machine (recommended 512 MB) by setting the -Xmx parameter in the debug configuration, for example -Xmx512m.
Make sure the [Oxygen-install-folder]/lib/oxygen.jar file and your Java extension classes are on the Java classpath.
substep.info: The Java extension classes should be the same classes that were set as an extension of the XSLT/XQuery transformation in the Oxygen debugging perspective.

substep.cmd: Set the class ro.sync.exml.Oxygen as the main Java class of the configuration.
substep.info: The main Java class ro.sync.exml.Oxygen is located in the oxygen.jar file.

step.info: Now you can set breakpoints and inspect Java variables as in any Java debugging process executed in the selected IDE (Eclipse SDK, and so on.).
